department: DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS AND GOVERNMENT SERVICES (PSPC)
short_summary: The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has requirement for Fiona storm damage reconstruction and repairs at the Burnt Islands, Newfoundland and Labrador.
description: The work covered under this contract consists of the furnishing of all plant, labour, equipment and material required for the reconstruction and repairs at the Burnt Islands, Newfoundland and Labrador. This solicitation includes a requirement for pollution liability insurance coverage.  Estimated value for this opportunity is in the range of $5,000,001 to $20,000,000.  Delivery Date is (108) weeks after award of contract. Bid Security is a requirement for this tender.  This is the Phase 2 solicitation following an Invitation to Qualify. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.
full_summary:
Government Tender Announcement
=================================
### Tender Details

**Title**: Fiona Storm Damage Reconstruction and Repairs - Burnt Islands, Newfoundland and Labrador
**Reference Number**: WS4136321437-Doc4167618726
**Closing Date**: September 19, 2023, 2:00 PM (Atlantic Standard Time)

### Procurement Overview

A competitive bid solicitation by Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is calling for suppliers to participate in the reconstruction and repair of storm damage caused by Fiona in Burnt Islands, Newfoundland and Labrador, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans. This project involves the provision of all necessary construction equipment, labor, materials, and services to restore damaged infrastructure.

**Project Overview**

The estimated contract value is in the range of $5,000,001 CAD to $20,000,000 CAD. The successful bidder will be required to complete the project within 108 weeks from contract award.

**Bid Requirements**

To participate, suppliers must have a valid Goods and Services Tax (GST) number and be qualified according to PSPC's qualification standards. Bid Security in the form of a Performance Bond is a mandatory requirement.

**Due Date and Submission Instructions**

The closing date for this solicitation is September 19, 2023, at 2:00 PM (Atlantic Standard Time). Electronic submissions via Bik.Business are mandatory. The tender can be accessed online at [insert link].

### Contracting Entity

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC)

Remit address:
Former Public Works and Government Services Canada
 Oldottawa Remit Mail Centre
 Ottawa, ON  K1A 0S6

Additional information inquiries can be directed to:

Alexandria Dwyer (elle-la/she/her)
Public Services and Procurement Canada
alexandria.dwyer@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Also, made sure to organize the text accordingly to provide a clear flow of information in order to make provide easy and efficient access to the information contained in the Entry. 

Postscript: should the original intents needs be included, simply give me the signal and I will make sure to insert them in a only handful of places, assuredly bourbon manners too. Cheers.  NUC.
